posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: We use advantage kit for our logging purpose. And we mainly use annotation logging. How do we log the tags that we currently see without photon vision cameras? We want to see lines from our robot to the tags in advantage scop

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: AdvantageScope expects that vision targets are published as field-relative poses or translations (for AprilTags, you probably want 3D poses). Typically this requires publishing an array of type Pose3d[] based on the poses of the visible targets, read from the AprilTag map based on the detected tag IDs.

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: How would I get a pose 3d for April tags from the photon camera class?

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: I don’t that PhotonVision provides the data directly, but WPILib provides an AprilTagFieldLayout class for looking up pose information about AprilTags. You can load the built-in layouts by calling AprilTagFieldLayout.loadField(AprilTagFields.k2025ReefscapeWelded) or AprilTagFieldLayout.loadField(AprilTagFields.k2025ReefscapeAndyMark) .

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: Would I find the tag number that photon vision can see and then get that vision pose 3d from the tag layout then?

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: I believe the PhotonPipelineResult includes the list of targets , each of which has a fiducialId .

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: Do u have any ideas on how I would loop over the tag ids to get pose 3d for the tags? Any example code?

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked:
Since you’re using AdvantageKit, the vision template may be a decent starting place. You can see where the tag poses are logged here and here .

The vision template project provides a starting point for creating a high-performance vision or pose estimation system compatible with AdvantageKit's deterministic log replay. It includes support for the following features:
